column16:
In December, a portion of NWF funds on accounts with the Bank of Russia in the amounts of 114.948 billion Chinese yuan, 232.585 tonnes of unallocated gold and 573.7 million euros was sold for 2.9 trillion rubles. The proceeds were credited to the unified federal budget account in order to finance its deficit. As a result of these conversion operations, the NWF account in euros with the Central Bank of Russia was zeroed out.
Also in December, funds in foreign currency in the amount of 62.505 billion Chinese yuan and 91.312 tonnes of unallocated gold, acquired at the expense of the federal budget in August-December as a result of additional oil and gas revenues of the federal budget, were credited to the relevant NWF accounts.

- by the beginning of 2024, the volume of the fund would be 12.177 trillion rubles, and replenishment was planned at 1.089 trillion rubles - initial assessment of liquid assets in September: 7.252 tr (so actually overestimation) - strangely the 570.2 kg of gold meant to have been sold do not modify the balance
- Strangely the 3kg of gold sold do not modify the balance

column15: https://tass.com/economy/1641933; https://www.interfax-russia.ru/main/fnb-v-iyule-vyros-na-643-2-mlrd-rub-do-13-3-trln-rub-likvidnaya-chast-sostavila-4-8-vvp; for different numbers for the liquid assets see here: https://www.interfax.ru/business/910240 (6.811 trillion rubles, or $78.258 billion, which corresponds to 4.5% of GDP)

column16: Previously, the Ministry of Finance announced the new regulatory structure of the National Welfare Fund, in which the share of the yuan and gold was doubled - to 60% and 40%, and also provided for the ability to reduce the share of any asset to zero. At the same time, the ministry announced the zeroing out of the balances of pounds sterling and yen in the accounts of the National Welfare Fund.
Disagreement on the level of liquid assets

14,823.8 million euros, 1,577.8 million pounds sterling, 240,333.7 million Japanese yen, 82,943.3 million Chinese yuan, as well as 149,202.2 kg. gold in impersonal form, purchased from federal budget funds within the volume of additional oil and gas revenues of the federal budget for 2021, are credited to the accounts for accounting funds of the National Welfare Fund
Definition: the liquid assets of the National Welfare Fund (funds in bank accounts with the Bank of Russia)
Sales of foreign currency to finance deficit
